EmailTemplate.subject: Glandular Fever
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
The International School of Moscow Part of The British Schools Group
Dear Parents,
We have had a single case of infectious mononucleosis (Glandular fever) on the Upper Campus.
The main symptoms are:
- extreme tiredness
- sore throat
- Fever 38 +
- swollen glands in the neck
Glandular fever is not usually a serious threat to a person's health, but can be unpleasant and last several weeks.
If your child has one or several of the above symptoms he/she should stay at home and checked by a doctor. A blood test is necessary to confirm if your child has infectious mononucleosis.
Please do let us know if your child has a confirmed case of the virus.
Best Regards
The ISM nursing team
